intro: Pteroceras spathipetalum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in warm, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
